Entries.default:
A constant low hum of conversation melds with the distant purr of cascading water. The warm scents of spices and cooked meats almost mask the stench of body odor.

Almost.

Several pairs of eyes watch you.

"I've never seen the proving entrance open before. Who are you?"

Sporting leather armor festooned with bright feathers, the woman holds herself like an experienced warrior - a veteran, based on her limp.
"A dead man told me to use a big rock to open the door."
"What is this place?"

"You're not here for the contest, then?"

Frowning, she scratches the back of her head.

"A dead man? A spirit, you mean?"

She taps her chin.
"Things change though. The contest has changed."
"You should speak with Humaire. If you've questions, she's the one to tell you more."
"Contest? This sounds suspiciously like illegal blood sport."
"Just what does this contest entail?"
"I knew there existed blood sports among the ancients of the Deadfire, but I thought modern Huana frowned on it."
"It's tradition. It goes back... I think over a thousand years. All officially sanctioned. ...I think."
She swallows and takes a step back.
"I'm [Player Name], Watcher of Caed Nua."
"Opening unopenable doors is why I wake up in the morning."
"I didn't come here to answer your questions."
"Among other things."

"That's this fortress back in the Dyrwood, where we're from. It's in great shape. Real imposing."

Ed√©r gives a firm nod.

"A Watcher?"

She swallows and looks to the door, then back to you.
"We ain't never been great with boundaries, friend."
She blinks twice before rolling her eyes with a sigh.
"I suppose that explains things. A bit. But why are you here?"
"Of - of course!" She takes a step back, glancing towards a nearby guard.
"Then what do you want?"
"Ah, the jesting type. Fantastic."

"The stories say the souls of this place once called to potential contenders, but I've never heard of anyone speaking to an actual ghost about it." 

She chuckles quietly.
"Each had to prove their worth by dragging the stone to the top of the rise. Hence the name. It would ensure that those who came to the arena were worthy of the honor."
"It's... complicated. Suffice it to say, we do battle with one another to prove ourselves to the Faces of the Hunt."
"Not everyone. Many merely spectate. Others run shops or see to the site's safety, as I do."
"Can you tell me more about Humaire?"
"Where can I find Humaire?"
"Who or what are the Faces of the Hunt?"
"Everyone here is a contestant?"
"Thank you for your help."
"Of course." She bows her head to you.
[Leave] "Farewell."
"Toamowhai. The hunter god. He oversees the contest. It's uh... easier experienced than explained."
"She maintains the arena, organizes trade, directs the wardens... things like that."

"Up top. She should be watching a match in the arena."

She gestures through the nearby door. A large set of stairs rise along the northern edge of the large, shadowy chamber beyond.
"Smell that? Smells real inviting."
"Everything seems to be in compliance around here. You have my permission to go back to killing each other."
"Ac, you sound very convincing."
"You hardly radiate confidence in the legitimacy of this event."
"The arena on Maje Island was built atop a substantial vein of adra. I wonder if that holds true here." He eyes the ancient stonework.
The guard scowls.
"She's not in charge, exactly. More a custodian chosen by the Faces. She communes with them."
"Trust her on that. You'll be meeting the Faces soon enough."
"Do I know you? You look familiar."
"Not unless you're doubling as a regular at the Wild Mare."
"The Queen of Kazuwari, in a manner of speaking."
"Hey, she's like their you."
"A woman in charge. Captain, how's about we make with the introductions sooner rather than later?"
"Sounds like the lass be running a right tight ship."
"How 'bout we put some distance between ourselves and the aumaua with blades."
"Welcome to the Temple of Toamowhai, Watcher! Home sweet home."
"Those who arrived at Kazuwari uninvited were considered 'soul-summoned.'"
"I was told people here needed my help."
"Your help?" With a slight frown, the guard scratches her shoulder in thought.
